lines.text: [first lines]
[Mike finds his secretary doing calisthenics in his office]
Angel, what are you doing?
My beauty exercises, Mike.
You don't need to do that.
Oh, no? With all those dizzy blondes throwing themselves at you, I'm not taking any chances. Besides, I want you to love me when I'm old and gray.
Why should a couple of years make a difference? Anyway, I'm allergic to blondes. Can I help it if I'm irresistible?
[Phyllis calls the homicide squad to report a murder]
This is Mike's secretary, Phyllis. A corpse just walked in and fell down on the floor.
What!
You don't have to shout at me. I said a corpse just walked in and fell down on the floor.
That's what I thought you said. Keep him there, I want to question him!
I can't keep paying blackmail the rest of my life.
What do you want me to do?
Well, he's an escaped convict. If you tried to arrest him and he should resist, you could...
Knock him off?
If that's what you want to call it.
It's a little out of my line. I haven't killed a husband in some time.
[Tim is rummaging through Phyllis' desk]
What are you looking for?
Bodies.
Oh, the janitor probably swept them out this morning.
I think I'll go see a blonde about a man.
Okay, let's go.
Oh, well, I won't need you this time - strictly business.
Your definition of business seems very elastic.
[Phyllis and Tim are standing in the middle of the wreckage of what used to be Mike's office]
What a mess.
Yeah, Mike seems to be on the wrong side of this case - they're bringing the fight to him!
Mike, your repulsive blonde is on the phone.
You mean "impulsive".
Hey, Mike. You're still holding out. Why? Don't you trust a federal agent or are you gambling with Phyll's life to cut yourself in on the deal?
Is that the way it looks to you?
Yeah.
You better get yourself a pair of glasses.
[the police have just arrested Mike's pretty client for multiple murders]
Well, that's one more blonde out of my life.
[last lines]
[with the case wrapped up, Tim slugs Mike]
I hated to do that Mike.
That's all right. I had it coming.
Hey! I didn't know I was livin' next door to a den of criminals. She was mighty cute, though. I tried to get better acquainted.
Yeah? You're lucky you didn't make the grade. You might have wound up in the morgue.
